column1: back of a length and swings slightly into the hips, clipped away easily to long leg
much fuller and angling away outside off, Guptill is stapled to the crease. He reaches out for the ball with hard hands and toe-ends a drive back to the bowler
good length and angling away outside off, Guptill attempts to drive on the up again, ends up mis-timing it to cover
just short of a good length and slanting away outside off, Guptill miscues it to cover. He inspects the toe end of the bat again

chest-high short ball on the off stump, skids on, and Guptill has been bounced out. This ball rushes Guptill into a hook and cramps him for room. He skies a biiiiig top edge. Thampi tracks it down at long leg. The extra pace from Sangwan surprised Guptill. Good work from Sangwan though, he had encouraged Guptill to drive, then got one to zip onto him quickly
back of a length on off, Amla hops and defends it in front of his feet
good length and outside off, driven on the front foot to cover
back of a length and outside off, punched crisply to the covers
full and angling away outside off, opens the face and helps the ball down to third man
half-volley outside off, driven on the up,  but Amla can't beat cover
back of a length and outside off, Amla responds with a back-foot drive to cover now
pitched up on a fourth-stump line, Amla takes it on the up, drives and finds mid-off. Just one off the over, happy return for Kulkarni
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, Marsh stands up tall and punches to cover
pitched up and outside off, crisply driven through the line, seems like that did not come onto the bat. Faulkner moves to his left from straight-ish mid-off and keeps it to one
Amla keeps timing the ball but keeps finding the fielders. Full and angling away outside off, another on-the-up drive, this one is hit straight to cover point
half-volley on the pads. Sangwan will get a thank-you note from Amla after the match. Twirls his wrists and flicks it away past midwicket

this is even better. Amla, standing outside leg, shuffles across the off stump. This is full and outside off, possibly a slower ball, the speedgun says 120ks, Amla flows forward and drives it through the covers
Amla jumps across off stump again, this one skids on, following the moving batsman. Amla eyes up the leg side, attempts a flick, and manages a leading edge, which does not carry to the bowler
Amla walks at the bowler. Kulkarni is wary of it and shortens his length outside off. Punched down towards mid-off
back of a length on middle, good bowling. Don't give Marsh room. Tucked away to deep midwicket
Amla stands outside leg, this is short and heading for the top of off. He shuffles across and punches to cover, where the fielder fumbles and allows a single
full, slower ball just a shade outside off. Marsh does not pick the change up. Looks to cut early and manages an inside edge onto the pad. The ball rolls towards cover and they pinch another single
Amla stands outside leg, so the bowler goes short and wide. Too wide, though. Off-side wide. Amla can't reach out and slice it away
short of a length on middle, forced to mid-on, the fielder throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end, but Amla is safe
full and sliding down leg, past the attempted, leg-side wide
just short of a good length on the hips, picked off to deep midwicket
beats the outside edge right away. This wasn't all that short for the cut. The width was there with the ball angling across off. Marsh looks to cut.... and misses
Marsh simply loves width. Pitched up and outside off, frees his arms and flashes an outside edge wide enough of backward point

Jadeja nearly pulls off a cracking catch. Short and wide outside off now to Amla, he cuts hard in the air. Jadeja propels himself to his right from backward point, attempts the catch with both hands, but it bursts out. Very difficult chance
back of a length and a hint of movement into Marsh to cram him for room, an inside edge trickles down the ground

That was so easy on the eye. This was on a good length on middle, it wasn't a poor ball. Amla made it look bad by backing away outside leg and driving it inside out over extra cover. He took it on the up and crunched it
short and attached with width outside off, Amla throws his bat at the ball and flashes it away towards Smith at cover point

and Amla welcomes him with a beautiful six. Good length and angling away outside off, Amla hits on the up and prospers again. He presses forward and lofts it through the line, clears mid-off and the boundary
back of a length on the hips, deflected square through the leg side. Amla did not get hold of the flick
back of a length and wide outside off, can't bowl there to Marsh. Faulkner gets away as Smith tumbles to his left from backward point and stops this cut from Marsh
full and attacking the stumps, this is pushed down towards long-on for one
overpitched on the leg stump, Amla times the pants off it. Front of the hand slower ball, flicked away to the left of deep square leg
good length on middle, tip and run in front of point
slides in with the arm, the length is short, Amla answers with a back-foot punch to long-off
short and slides in with the arm again, picked off the hips past midwicket
hurled into the pads, flatter, tickled to short fine leg
Jadeja finds some turn, but the length is short, allowing Amla to camp back and clip it away to leg
hip-high short ball outside off. Width to Marsh = asking for trouble. He skips back and dispatches it to the midwicket boundary with a pull
fired short and just a shade outside off, nearly 100ks, Marsh sits back and punches through the leg side
floated up outside off, driven off the front foot to long-on for one
Soni gives this more air outside off, no real turn, driven straight to cover
dragged down outside off, Marsh was probably looking to pull it squarer. He himself ends up dragging it to wide long-on
pushed through on off stump, Amla brings his wrists into play again, directing the ball to deep midwicket
low full-toss on the off stump, Marsh pounced on the error in length. Whipping it away between deep midwicket and long-on - the two men in the deep on the leg side
non-turning ball outside off, driven again, this time straight to long-on
flat dart on the pads, 100ks, Marsh simply uses the pace of Jadeja to his advantage and flicks it away square of short fine leg for four
turns into the hips, tickled straight to short fine leg now
shorter and slid down leg, left alone, leg-side wide
picked off the hips square of short fine leg, deep square leg tidies up in the deep
slid through flat on middle, 101ks, Amla sits back and punches a single to long-on
Jadeja keeps firing these darts, eased off the pads to short fine leg
pushed through on off, back-foot drive to deep cover. Time for a time out
floats a slower, full  ball outside off, Amla opens the face and guides it straight to point
full and veering into the pads, clipped away to the right of deep square leg. Amla wants two and gets it in the end
back of the hand slower ball outside off, 107ks, Amla manufactures his own pace and forces the ball to sweeper
full and outside off, slower one from over the wicket, Marsh picks the variation. He opens the face but guides it straight to short third man
low full-toss, seam-up ball, angled in on middle, driven down the ground to long-on
really full - low full-toss in fact - and it's veering down the leg side, Marsh simply helps it on its way and beats deep square sliding to his right in the deep
flighted, full on middle and leg, driven with the wrists to long-on
tossed on middle stump, Marsh stretches forward and milks a single down to long-on
slower legbreak just outside off, Amla looks to drive over extra cover. He ends up slicing it squarer over point off a swirling outside leg. Sweeper runs to his left to mop it up
full and outside off, driven through the line to long-off
Marsh uses his feet, gets close to the pitch of this full ball on off, and clips it away to long-on
liberally tossed up outside off, Amla knows there is no cover, and exploits it with a drive
back of the hand slower ball outside off, 112ks, Marsh capitalises on the width, picks the change up and late-cuts it to the right of short third man
goes for the yorker, ends up overpitching it, picked away between deep midwicket and long leg
back of a length and outside off, hit to long-on again
back of a length on the hips, Amla uses his wrists and eases the ball to deep midwicket
back of a length on off, the ball isn't coming ball, worked with soft hands to leg
good length and on the pads, nudged to leg leg for one more
full legbreak around off, dips on Amla, he closes the face and lobs a leading edge wide of cover
tossed up outside off, Amla lofts it down to long-on. Amla's fifty and the hundred stand in one blow. Solid platform for Kings XI
floated outside leg, might have been a wide had the left-hander left it. Instead, he gets low and paddles it just wide of short fine leg
dropped short and spins away outside off, Amla misses a scoring opportunity. Chops straight to point
tossed up outside off and breaks away further, regulation legbreak, Amla aims to mow it over midwicket. Beaten lavishly

another tossed-up legbreak outside off, this time he does not look for the mow over the leg side. He lofts it through the line, putting the ball over the long-off boundary. All class from Amla. Smart too, given the straight boundaries are quite short at this venue
starts a new spell with a slower offcutter outside off, opens the face and angles it to point
another slow ball, back of a length, too straight in line, flicked through square leg
third slower ball in a row, 114ks outside off, Marsh opens the face and guides it in the gap at cover. He brings up his fifty off 37 balls
wide full-toss outside off, seam-up, Amla throws his bat at the ball, and sends an outside edge to short third man
slower short ball on off, Amla waits for it to arrive, then swats it away to deep square leg
another slower bouncer outside off, think Amla did not spot this. He flashes early... and misses. Fifth slower ball of the over
back of a length and angling away outside off, Marsh brings out his favourite square cut. Leans back and hits it backward of point
really full and just outside leg, Marsh clips it to short fine leg
and he bowls a full-toss on middle stump, which is swatted away square of short fine leg
really full on middle, Marsh manufactures room by stepping away outside leg and carving it to backward point
Amla feigns to step away outside leg, the bowler is wary of it and pushes it wide outside off. Amla  toe-ends a scoop to short third man
attempted short ball outside off, keeps a bit low, Marsh bends low ans chops it away to sweeper cover. These two need to kick into a higher gear now
slower full ball on middle, Marsh stays leg side of the ball and dinks a single to cover
another slower ball outside off, Kulkarni keeps dealing in slower ball. Swiped away to the right of wide long-on. Faulkner slides to his right and stops the ball
off-stump yorker, Amla is equal to it, slicing it away square through the off side
Marsh toe-ends a catch to Finch at long-on. Kulkarni breaks the stand. Good length ball on the leg stump, Marsh can't get under it. He skies it to the man in the deep
Amla clears long-on. Slower ball outside off, 108ks, Amla reads the variation - the offcutter. Clears his front leg and launches it over long-on
overpitched and outside off, smeared to cover
good length on off, 141ks, punched on the back foot through cover

this is just 90ks, slower ball on the leg stump, about 50ks slower than the last ball. Amla manufactures all the pace. Opens up his hips and tonks it over midwicket. The key to all this: a stable base
off-stump yorker, Amla clears his front leg and drills a single down to long-on
Maxwell backs away outside leg, Thampi nails the yorker. Superb execution. Right in the blockhole on off, Maxwell digs a single to cover point

whoa, shot (please give me a moment to pick my jaw up from the floor) Amla shuffles across off, aims for the scoop fine over leg. Thampi spots it and fires a low full-toss outside off. Amla changes his shot, but maintains his balance, and scoops it fine of short third man. Amla proving finesse and timing has a place in the T20 world
short and really wide outside off, scythed away over point
Maxwell steps out and yorks himself. Dug out on off
yorker on leg stump, Maxwell brings his bottom hand into play and shovels it to long-on
full on the stumps, not quite a yorker, gloriously driven down the ground, splitting long-on and long-off
low full-toss on off, dragged away to long-on
middle-stump yorker, dug out to long-on
low full-toss outside off, Amla uses his wrists and slices it in the air, keeping deep point interested. Sangwan runs in from there and attacks the ball, but the ball drops short
really full and outside off, Maxwell golf-swings it in the air. Does not carry to long-off
banged in short and just a shade outside off, Maxwell is rushed into a hook. Top-edges it over the bowler's head and gets away
Amla shuffles across off, this is pushed wider of him. Amla still drives it to long-off
hip-high short ball just outside off, poor length, Maxwell pounces on it. Sits deep in the crease and muscles it over deep midwicket
good length and outside off, Maxwell hits it against the angle. Mis-hits it, gets more height and enough distance. Clears long-on
Maxwell pre-meditates to reverse-paddle it fine on the off side, this is speared wide outside off. Maxwell only connects with a whole lot of thin air
misses the yorker, ends up offering a full toss on off, Amla drives it inside out over extra cover. Amla moves to 97
slower short ball on middle, forces a pull to deep midwicket
yorker on the leg stump - or a near yorker - shovelled away to long-on with the bottom hand

Amla reaches his second IPL hundred with a six!. This is a cross seamer - full and outside off - Amla creams it inside out over cover for a flat six. Sublime innings. He had reached his last ton with a six in the last over of the innings as well. Nice symmetry
Thampi nails the yorker, this swings in a bit and raps him on the front pad. He plays across the line and is pinned in front. What an innings, though. He walks off to a rousing reception
just misses the yorker, ends up as an off-stump full-toss, which is swiped away to long-on
starts off with a full inswinger, which finishes on off, prodded to midwicket off an inside edge
half-volley on the pads, real bad ball, Kishan simply helps it away past the right of short fine leg and opens his account with a four
back of a length and comes in on off stump, punched to mid-on
good length on off, opens the face and pushes to cover
back of a length and swings in, worked to deep midwicket
back of a length on off and middle, cramps him for room, pushed to mid-on

starts with a full one on the pads, and that's easy pickings for Smith. Deep square leg is a fair distance in front of square, and fine leg is in the circle. Smith clips it away neatly through backward square leg
bouncer over off stump, good follow-up. Smith ducks under it.
slower ball, overpitched with some width on it. Smith waits that fraction longer to account for the change of pace, and then puts it away between extra-cover and mid-off
length ball on middle and off, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, slanting across Kishan. Defended to midwicket
short ball, pulled in the air, on the bounce, to deep square leg
not that short, it was heading towards the middle of the off bail. Kishan sits deep in his crease to pull to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
short, just a bit of width, and Smith stands tall with left elbow high to punch that away to the cover boundary
back of a length, a bit of nip away towards off stump, defended into the covers
fullish, a bit of outswing towards off stump, shows the full face to punch it back to the bowler, who dives right in his follow-through to stop it
back of a length close to off stump and extra-cover puts in a solid dive to his right to stop that firm punch from Smith
length  ball on middle stump and Smith just leans on it and shows the full face. Flies off that bat face and mid-on has to throw himself full-length to his left to stop it from running away for four
back of a length, angling into off stump, stays on the back foot and plays through midwicket with a straight bat

short, wide, that just sat up. Looked like the attempted slower bouncer but it was just too wide. Smith had a lot of time and he used it well, waited and slapped it into the gap between cover point and extra-cover

ooh, good ball. Straightens from just back of a length. Smith was looking to use the initial angle into off stump to play through midwicket, closed his bat face early, and it popped up off the leading edge and bounced away to the right of third man
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched to mid-off, who's stationed deep enough to allow a straightforward single
full on middle stump with a bit of outswing. Smith judiciously plays with a straight bat to push towards long-on
short outside off, rises quite high and Kishan is off his feet to slash that away to the left of third man

full on middle and leg, this time Smith stays leg-side of the ball. Smart adjustment, he knows he has a bit of outswing to play with, and that mid-off is in the circle. Hits it slightly inside-out, to the left of the bowler and the right of mid-off, and hits it crisply
back of a length, angling into the body. Looks to pull but it isn't short enough, rolls off the thigh pad into the square leg region

full, angling into the stumps, clipped to midwicket. No-ball called - he's not overstepped, I think. The umpire is indicating something. Were there were more than two fielders outside the circle? Or did he not inform the umpire of his change to around the wicket? Smith's position suggests it may have been the latter.
full on middle stump, swiped away along the ground to long-on. Too full to get any elevation on that
length ball on off stump, and that's such a sweet hit. Again he stayed leg-side of the ball and hit inside-out, this time driving on the up between mid-off and extra-cover
slower ball, fairly full, on leg stump. They've been wary of giving him swinging room today, bowled close to his body. Pushes gently into the covers to bring Smith back on strike
bouncer, second time he's bowled one to Smith. He ducks again.
length ball on middle and leg, Smith clears his front leg and clubs it away. Doesn't quite middle it, but he clears the infield comfortably and gets a one-bounce four

dropped, Miller drops a dolly! Slower ball, offcutter, slightly back of a length outside off. Smith had cleared his front leg again and had to reach out a bit to try and slog it over mid-off. Didn't catch it well at all, and it went waaay up and down to the man at extra-cover, Miller, who drops the easiest of high catches
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to the right of short fine leg
again, on the pads - they've made a big effort to deny Kishan width - and he clips it quietly to midwicket's left
short outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length on the pads, worked to the left of short fine leg
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle and off, punched to long-on
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to whip it with the turn to long-on
full on middle stump, Axar's first full ball, and Smith puts it away. Gets under it and brings in immense bat-speed to launch that over long-on
short, on off stump and Kishan rocks back quickly and swivels through the hips to pull fiercely between long-on and deep midwicket
flat length ball on off stump, punched to short cover

short and wide, and the sweeper is too far in front of square to be able to stop that cut. Placed that really well, hit it hard and beat backward point to his left and the desperately sweeper to his right
length ball outside off, stretches out to push to long-off
dropped, another! Short ball, and he leans back to club that hard, down the ground. Gurkeerat, diving forward, gets both hands to the low chance but can't hold on
more salt in Kings XI's wounds. Back of a length on off stump, and Smith clears his front leg and just clears the man at long-off with a big swing of his bat
shortish again, makes some room to punch to deep point
back of a length on off stump, worked with the turn to deep midwicket
short, wide, bowled very slow. Slapped to deep point
back of a length outside off, steps back to pull to long-on
short and wide again, this time quicker. Looks to use the pace and play a cute dab to third man, but he's a bit late on it and the ball beats his edge
short ball angling into the body. Misses the pull and it ricochets off his body to the left of the keeper

gone, this time Miller holds on. Fuller this time, angling into the stumps, and Kishan, taking a stride down the pitch, slogs it to the left of deep midwicket - not as far to his left as he'd have liked - and Miller takes a good tumbling catch
ooh, inside-edge first ball.  Back of a length, he wanted to push that into the covers, the ball nipped back a bit, hit the inside edge of his angled bat, and rolled down to fine leg

That means long-on is back, but Smith is okay with that. Full on middle and leg, and he gets his front leg out of the way and just jabs that, rapid bat speed, and it soars high over the fielder at long-on
back of a length, a bit of inward movement maybe. Looks to stay leg-side of the ball and punch to mid-off, ends up inside-edging into the leg side
overpitched on the pads, and that's easily put away, between deep square leg and fine leg
back of a length, angling down leg. Smith misses the glance, the ball rolls off his thigh pad to the left of Sah
short on off stump, Raina jumps back and across and tucks it off his body through square leg
short and wide, rolled his fingers over and that stops on Smith. Chops it away to deep point

Raina shuffles across, tries to work this back-of-a-length ball through square leg, and gets undone by the slower ball. Misses, the ball gets jammed in his pad and drops by his feet. He thinks there's an opportunity for a leg-bye but turns back quickly when he sees the bowler sprint towards the ball. Pitched outside leg, so no appeal
bouncer, and Raina clobbers that, tennis-style. Clears his front leg, sits deep in his crease, and slaps that wide of midwicket
short ball at the body, Raina jumps across and shovel-pulls off his hip and finds the gap to the left of fine leg
bang. That seemed to be some sort of leg-roller floated across, wide of off stump. Clears his front leg and smashes that hard and high, back over the bowler's head

gone, finally. Two lives, but not a third one. Back of a length, angling across to off stump. Gets down low after clearing his front leg, slogs it hard, and picks out Guptill at deep midwicket. Just the tiniest opening for Kings XI
flat non-turner angled into middle stump. Makes room to push to sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, clipped to the left of short fine leg
shortish on off stump, pulled to long-on
length ball on middle stump, looks to clip to long-on for the single, but Maxwell moves quickly in
shortish, close to off stump, waits on it and dabs to the right of short third-man
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and clips to deep midwicket
shortish on the stumps, pulled to deep midwicket
fullish on middle stump, clipped away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, makes some room to chop it away to deep point

length ball outside off, fairly wide. I think he spotted DK moving across, looking to sweep past short fine leg. Goes for the shot anyway, misses, ball clips pad and loops over the keeper, to the left of short third man
full outside off, driven firmly, and the man at extra-cover, diving to his right, lets it slip through his grasp. Maxwell moves quickly from sweeper cover to keep it down to one run
fullish, close to off stump, driven to long-off
slower short ball wide of off stump, DK was moving down the track, steps across to pull to deep midwicket
slower ball on middle and off, clipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to direct that to long-on
slower ball floated full and wide, Raina stretches out to
Sees Raina step out and bowls it short and wide of off stump. Raina waits and cuts it away to the point boundary
down the track again, this time Natarajan follows him, bowls it at his body. Looks to flick and the ball beats his inside edge, hits his pad, and rolls away into the short third-man region
back of a length, angling into off stump. Karthik steps across, uses the angle to work it to the left of fine leg
full outside off, driven to the right of deep point
slower ball, full and wide, gets a big stride forward and stabs it out to deep point
in the blockhole, at Raina's feet. Gets his front foot out of
full, close to off stump, jabbed down to long-off
full on middle and off, whipped to long-on

slower ball on leg stump. Spotted Raina looking to make himself room, I think, bowled it right up there and off-pace. Looks to drive through the off side, puts too much bottom hand on it and drags it  back to the bowler
low full-toss on off stump, swiped away to deep midwicket
back-of-a-length offcutter on off stump, flat-batted down to long-off

slower length ball on middle and off, offcutter, and Raina picked it late. Looked to slog over wide mid-on, checked his shot, and still, somehow, got enough on it to clear the leaping Maxwell moving left from long-on
down the track and Aaron bowls a wide-ish ball, pulls his length back a bit. Opens his bat face and pokes it to backward point
slower bouncer outside off, no pace for DK to use as he tries to ramp over the keeper. He misses, tennis-ball bounce over his bat, rolls down to the keeper
back of a length legcutter on off stump, opens his bat face to dab to the right of Saha, who throws himself horizontally to stop it with an outstretched arm

dropped, again. Makes room, Raina, and Aaron bowls a slower offcutter on a good length. Looks for the slice over extra-cover, ends up miscuing to the right of long-off, and Gurkeerat, sprinting and diving forward, can't hold on despite getting both hands to it
yorker outside off, Raina makes too much room and ends up missing the ball while trying to squeeze it through point
backs away from the stumps again and Aaron follows him with the shortish ball at the body. Bunted down the ground to long-on

vital blow. Full on leg stump, Raina clears his front leg and looks to slog it away, he's working against the angle and can't middle it, and he skews it off the outside half of his bat. Gurkeerat takes one this time, moving to his right from deep midwicket
down the track and Sandeep shortens his length just enough while cutting down on room. Karthik defends to the on side and calls Finch through for a single
slower short ball, chest-high outside off. Finch spots it late, plays a controlled pull through square leg. The lack of pace on the ball allows them to run two
another bouncer, not the slower one this time, and it takes off steeply. Finch, looking to pull from over his right shoulder, gets a thin edge through to Saha, and are Kings XI back in this?
slower ball on a good length outside off. Jadeja doesn't pick it, slogs and misses

Is that the third wicket of the over? If so, it's a run-out! Very full on the stumps, Jadeja clears his front leg and swipes to the right of long-on. They chance a second, and the dive saves Jadeja at the keeper's end, just about
slower length ball on off stump, eased to deep point with a straight bat

back of a length, angling into the body, and that's a highly fortunate six from Karthik. No boundaries in 17 balls before this, and he has a big slog at this. Top-edge, over the keeper, and it just keeps going and going and soars into the stands. Aaron's pace worked against him there.
short, wide, and this is a poor delivery from Aaron with third man and backward point inside the circle. Karthik deliberately sliced under that, and cut it over backward point
fuller now, angling into off stump, flat-batted firmly to long-off

slower ball, back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to steer to the left of backward point. Unnecessary throw at the bowler's end from Marsh concedes an overthrow. It was inaccurate, the bowler had to hurry to collect, and fumbled
full-toss, flicked away to the left of deep midwicket

Slanted full and wide, and he opens his bat face and steers to the left of deep point. They run two, and another inaccurate throw - Gurkeerat at the bowler's end - is fumbled by Natarajan, and he concedes another overthrow.
looks for the yorker at Jadeja's feet, ends up overdoing the angle and sliding down leg
and again. The pressure is really telling on Natarajan here. An attempted leg-stump yorker slides down the leg side
in the blockhole, leg-stumpish. Clipped down the ground to long-on
Dot ball! It's the wide yorker, attempted at least. Ends up as a full-toss. Karthik swings hard, gets a thin outside edge that bounces a second time before reaching the keeper

and that is that. There was no one on the boundary, and Karthik puts the slower length ball away calmly, hitting inside-out over extra-cover, and it rolls slowly to the boundary to give Lions a six-wicket win.
